definition: people living on the frontiers/inhabitants of a border area
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: At present, some of these people have returned home.
sentences.chinese: 目前一些边民已经陆续返回。

sentences.english: Borderers' trade is a common economic activity in border areas.
sentences.chinese: 边民互市是边境地区常见的经济贸易活动。

sentences.english: Will the two sides discuss Chinese nationals who live on the Myanmar side of the border?
sentences.chinese: 会不会讨论中缅边境的边民骚乱问题？

sentences.english: Haven! t you noticed the validity period of the Board Resident Certificate?
sentences.chinese: 你没有注意到边民证的有效期吗？

sentences.english: Thousands of settlers came to know this strange, lonely man.
sentences.chinese: 边民们都认识这个孤独的怪人。

definition: to cross a border (usually illegally)/to sneak in or out of a country
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
to garrison the border/to guard the frontier/exile to a border garrison post
border station/strategic defensive position on frontier
businessmen and travelers/traveling merchant/(Tw) business hotel
to open up land for cultivation/to garrison troops to open up land
